title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on coordination, communication, and scientific representation in public health policy decisions related to tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will ensure interagency coordination, represent diverse scientific viewpoints in public health policy decisions, and advise Federal agencies on priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases. Membership includes appointed voting members from the scientific community and representatives of tick-borne disease groups. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee membership requirements include 4 scientific community members, 2 tick-borne disease organization representatives, 2 healthcare providers, 2 patient representatives, and 2 state and local health department representatives. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes members diagnosed with tick-borne diseases or with family members who have been diagnosed, representatives from State and local health departments, and ex officio members from Federal agencies overseeing tick-borne disease activities. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee includes nonvoting, ex officio members from various Federal agencies, with the Secretary designating the Assistant Secretary for Health as the co-chairperson. Appointed members serve 4-year terms, and a public co-chairperson is elected for a 2-year term. Vacancies in the Committee membership are addressed accordingly. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee members serve 4-year terms, with a public co-chairperson elected for a 2-year term. Vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment, and meetings are held at least twice a year with additional meetings as needed. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee meets at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed. Meetings are conducted as required by law and regulations. The Committee must submit an annual report to the Secretary, detailing its functions, members, activities, and recommendations. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee meets regularly and must submit an annual report to the Secretary. An authorization of appropriations of $250,000 for each fiscal year is allocated for the Committee's expenses and per diem costs, following the Federal Advisory Committee Act guidelines. Voting members cannot be permanent salaried employees.
